comment.author: 41675580@N08
comment._content: Hi, I'm an admin for a group called Nautical pictures of interest., and we'd love to have this added to the group! A very nice and clear picture.

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: A wonderful photo, which prompted me to do a bit of googling . . . Union-Castle Line 1896-1928. Used as a hospital ship in WW1 particularly at Gallipoli in 1915. History and vivid description of Gallipoli landing by the Fourth Officer here - www.unioncastlestaffregister.co.uk/SHIP_GASCON_(2)_01.html . My own grandfather was wounded at Gallipoli and could well have been on this hospital ship. Luckily he survived, otherwise I would not be writing this. Thanks NMM for a special glimpse into the past.

comment.author: 14940992@N04
comment._content: Thanks for posting the photo. My great, great uncle was wounded in action at Gallipoli and evacuated aboard the Gascon in April/May 1915, so I was very pleased to find a good photo of the ship.
